thread.title: Cubs Will Keep Schwarber's Home Run Ball Atop Video Scoreboard Until Postseason Ends
thread.title_full: Cubs Will Keep Schwarber's Home Run Ball Atop Video Scoreboard Until Postseason Ends

author: Louis Milman
title: Cubs Will Keep Schwarber's Home Run Ball Atop Video Scoreboard Until Postseason Ends
text:
Share Article 
Photo by Jonathan Daniel/Getty Images (CHICAGO) -- The Chicago Cubs plan to keep a home run ball hit by rookie Kyle Schwarber in the team's NLDS-clinching victory over the St. Louis Cardinals exactly where it landed, at least for now.Schwarber's home run, which landed atop a new video scoreboard in right field at Wrigley Field, will remain there, with glass placed over it to keep it from being stolen. Here's the glass being placed over Schwarber's HR ball from last night atop the RF video board (via @BannerVideo ) pic.twitter.com/LF0jbkZva8 — Danny Ecker (@DannyEcker) October 14, 2015 
Cubs spokesman Julian Green told ESPN on Wednesday that the decision was made in part because "it's the first year of the video scoreboards; it's the first year the Cubs have ever clinched at home; and it's the first time someone has hit a ball up there."The 22-year-old Schwarber has shown a penchant for hitting longballs this October, launching three in just five postseason games. The Cubs intend to retrieve the ball after the postseason ends, though they have not determined what they will do with it at that point.
